title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-9.2 - Use of New York State Infant Autopsy Protocol
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 69-9.2 - Use of New York State Infant Autopsy Protocol

State Regulations

When an autopsy is performed on a person under the age of one year who dies under circumstances in which death is not anticipated by medical history or the cause is unknown, such autopsy must be performed in accordance with the New York State Infant Autopsy Protocol. This provision shall be subject to the limitations of section
4210-c
of the Public Health Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
69-9.2

Amended

New

York State Register November 13, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 46, eff. 11/13/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
